intro: Corylopsis stenopelala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flame-twist, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Hamamelidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late autumn. The plant features narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant for gardens. Its unique flowering period and attractive foliage make it a valuable addition to horticultural collections.
